perturbation.original_text: Company shall comply with good business practices and all applicable laws and regulations.
perturbation.changed_text: Company shall endeavor to comply with good business practices and applicable laws and regulations.
perturbation.explanation: The phrase 'endeavor to comply' weakens the obligation and introduces ambiguity, as it does not guarantee full compliance. It suggests an attempt rather than a mandatory adherence to laws and regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) and other regulations require strict compliance; suggesting a mere 'endeavor' is insufficient.

perturbation.original_text: Subject to the terms of this Agreement, Company grants Reseller the right to use and display the Company trademarks, tradenames and other designations of source, and proprietary notices, slogans, designs and distinct advertising as may appear on any documentation or other material with respect to Product ("Marks") with prior approval, that will not be unreasonable withheld.
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to the terms of this Agreement, Company grants Reseller the right to use and display the Company trademarks, tradenames and other designations of source, and proprietary notices, slogans, designs and distinct advertising as may appear on any documentation or other material with respect to Product ("Marks") with reasonable effort to obtain prior approval.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'with prior approval, that will not be unreasonably withheld' to 'with reasonable effort to obtain prior approval' makes the approval process ambiguous. It's unclear what constitutes 'reasonable effort,' potentially allowing the Reseller to use trademarks without proper consent, conflicting with trademark law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Lanham Act, which governs trademark usage and requires explicit permission to avoid infringement.

perturbation.original_text: Company shall indemnify, defend and hold Reseller and its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, agents, successors and assigns, harmless from and against any claim, demand lawsuit, cause of action or losses of any nature whatsoever, including reasonable attorneys' fees, suffered or incurred by Reseller or any of them, arising out of, (i) any claim that the Company Products infringe any U.S. patent or copyright or that the Company Products incorporate any misappropriated trade secrets or (ii) any claim for injury or other loss to any person arising from the use of Company Products.
perturbation.changed_text: Company will endeavor to indemnify, defend and hold Reseller and its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, agents, successors and assigns, harmless from and against any claim, demand lawsuit, cause of action or losses of any nature whatsoever, including attorneys' fees, suffered or incurred by Reseller or any of them, arising out of, (i) any claim that the Company Products infringe any U.S. patent or copyright or that the Company Products incorporate any misappropriated trade secrets or (ii) any claim for injury or other loss to any person arising from the use of Company Products, provided such indemnification is deemed appropriate.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Company shall indemnify' to 'Company will endeavor to indemnify, provided such indemnification is deemed appropriate' makes the indemnification obligation discretionary. The ambiguity around who decides what is 'appropriate' and under what circumstances weakens the legal protection for the Reseller.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles require clear and enforceable indemnification clauses; this change undermines the enforceability.
